article_title: How do I kick or ban players from my room?

structured_content.content: If someone's being unruly in one of your rooms, you have the option to ban them from the room. You can also ban players from any rooms to which your friends have granted you moderation rights.
Ban a player from any room to which you have moderation privileges by tapping on their avatar and then tapping ‚ÄúKick from room‚Äù in the small black popup menu right above your chatbox.
Be careful who you kick from your rooms! Once players have been banned from a room, it‚Äôs permanent. While you can always unblock, you cannot unban players from  rooms.

article_title: How do I block someone?

structured_content.content: When someone's bothering you, block them and you won't hear from them again! You can always unblock if you're feeling magnanimous at a later point.
Block by visiting the player's profile page, tapping the ellipses in the upper right corner, and then selecting block. This will prevent all their personal messages and posts from reaching you.

If you‚Äôve blocked someone and would like to renew communications, visit their profile page and follow the same steps you use to block in order to unblock. Just tap the ellipses icon in the upper right.
Blocking is underutilized! It‚Äôs an easy way to cut off contact with anyone who may be irritating to you.

article_title: How do I appeal a mute, suspension, or ban?

structured_content.content: Mistakes can happen - we're all human, after all! If you feel your account was wrongly penalized, or you would like us to reconsider our decision, you can send an appeal by contacting our support team via the HelpCenter.
Please be patient with us while we review your appeal! It may take a few days for us to get back to you. The time it takes will depend on how complicated your case is, and our current ticket volume.
Before sending an appeal, please note:
Only the owner of an account can send an appeal.
Some accounts are not eligible for appeal, especially in cases where there are extreme safety concerns.
Be kind. Even if you were wrongly banned, it's important to be respectful. If we made a mistake, we will make it right! Any profanity or threats sent to staff will be ignored.
Be honest. Authenticity and owning your mistakes is an important part our community culture.
You are responsible for what happens on your account. This means that if your friend or family member used your account and broke the rules, it's on you!
All appeal decisions are final and at the discretion of our Trust and Safety team.

article_title: How do I use Voice Chat?

structured_content.content: Looking to liven up your rooms with the sound of voices? Let's add a pinch of Voice Chat! It's easy for the room owner and moderators to start the party under the "People in Room" menu. Just part with 200 gold for an hour of voice chat magic. Don't worry, if an hour isn't enough, you can always extend the fun.

A couple of pop-ups will pop up when you start. One is just checking if we can use your microphone (you know, for the voice part of Voice Chat). If you accidentally hit "deny", you'll need to pop into your device's settings to allow access.

Once you've got the Voice Chat up and running, you can mute your mic with a tap if you need a moment of silence. As the room owner or moderator, you also get the power to invite anyone in the room to join the voice chat. Don't worry, they'll get a friendly pop-up invite to join the chat.
Keep an eye on the Visitors Bar - it'll show you who's got Voice Chat privileges. If you see a crossed-out mic, it means that player is currently keeping quiet.
You'll see the following options on the Voice Chat menu:
Deafen Voice: For when you need a little peace and quiet.
Report the Room's Voice: If there's something not quite right, you can send a report to the person who started the voice chat.
End Voice: Only the room owner or moderator can use this to end the voice chat.

Wondering why Voice Chat costs gold? It's not just to fill our coffers! The partner we're working with to provide Voice Chat charges us a pretty penny. The gold fee helps us cover some of those costs. Plus, by making it a paid feature, it helps us keep trolls and negativity at bay for a friendlier chat experience.

As for the age restriction, we put it in place to keep our younger players safe. They won't be able to start Voice Chat or see rooms with Voice Chat in their directory if they are under 18. Safety first, fun second!

article_title: What Is Spectating?

structured_content.content: Got an audience? Flip on Spectating and let countless eyes enjoy the spectacle unfolding in your room. It's like a reality show, but way more interesting!
‚Äã

Turning on Spectating is as simple as flicking a light switch. Just stroll over to your Room Settings. Remember, only the Room Owner has the power to turn on or off the Spectating spotlight. Let's show the world how it's done!

So, you're curious about this Spectating mode, huh? Think of it as your personal TV channel - when your room is bursting at the seams, any newcomers transform into spectators, silently watching the magic unfold.
‚Äã
Finding out who's watching is easy peasy! Just pop into the "People in Room" tab, and you'll see a list of spectators and active visitors.
Wondering what spectators can do? Well, they can:
Enjoy the show, watching avatars and text chats in action
Tune into a live Voice Chat, just like a podcast
Send Tips to any player strutting their stuff in the room
Shoot off emoji reactions (hearts, winks) to show appreciation
But, there are a few no-nos for spectators. They can't:
Stroll around or be seen in the room (it's a no-ghost zone!)
Join in the text chat or Voice Chat

If a spot opens up, all the spectators will get an invite to join the room. It's a race - the quickest to hit "Join" gets in. But hey, no pressure! If you prefer being a silent observer, keep on spectating till the cows come home!
‚Äã

So you're a wallflower at heart, and you just want to watch? I got you! As long as the room owner has enabled the Spectating feature and the room is filled to the brim, you can slip into spectator mode - no mingling necessary!
Worried about a crowd? Don't be! Your room is a theater, and there's no limit on ticket sales. Pack in as many spectators as you like, the more, the merrier!

Now, let's chat about the law of the land. In the wild world of spectating, rules are the same for everyone. Just like any other visitor, Spectators can be kicked, banned, and reported by room moderators. And yes, you can report someone who's misbehaving, too. It's our collective responsibility to keep this a fun and safe space for all, right? So, let's watch out for each other!

article_title: What Are Crew Rooms?

structured_content.content: Dreaming of a crew clubhouse? Longing for a joint project? Look no further than Crew Rooms! It's your favorite hangout spot, customized by your crew, perfect for just hanging or flexing your team's creative muscle in our build competitions!
Ready to break ground? Here's how you set the stage:
Stroll over to the Room Directory page. It's a click away on the little door icon at your screen's lower-left corner.
Tap "My Rooms" on the bottom bar - your own little corridor to all your rooming wonders.
At the screen's top, you'll see three tabs: "My Rooms," "Crew Rooms," and "Favorites." Go ahead, tap on the Crew Rooms tab. We dare ya!
Found the bottom of the Crew Room list? Great! Now hit "Add Room." Tada! You've just made a Crew Room!

Think of this room as a shared clubhouse. Every crew member co-owns it and can play interior designer. Tweak who can enter and who can keep the peace under room settings. But, just like a real clubhouse, no nabbing each other's stuff! You can move any placed furniture, but only its owner can remove it.
So gather your crew, pull out your virtual tools, and start constructing your cozy crew corner!

article_title: How Do I Delete a Room?

structured_content.content: Ready for a room revamp? Or perhaps you're just in the mood for a good old decluttering? Let's tidy up that rooms list of yours.
Here's the secret recipe to room removal:

Saunter into your 'Room Settings'. You can do this by tapping on the room name when you're in the room, or tap the ‚Äúi‚Äù icon next to the room name when you're scanning your rooms list in the directory.
Next, tap "Edit" in the upper right corner. It's like a magic button to control your room's destiny.
Scroll to the bottom of the Basic Information tab, where you'll find the secret trap door, otherwise known as 'Delete Room'.

But wait! This step is as permanent as a tattoo, so think before you tap. All your furniture will be booted back to your inventory faster than you can say "Spring cleaning!" And if your friends left any of their stuff, it'll go back to their inventory too.
So, get ready, set, declutter!

article_title: How Do I Add Music to My Room?

structured_content.content: Party without tunes? As exciting as watching paint dry, right? Or, perhaps you're seeking Zen and need the gentle strums of a mandolin wafting through your digital garden. Whatever your vibe, let's add some beats to your room!
Here's your backstage pass to setting the soundtrack:
Find your way to 'Room Settings'. You can either tap on the room name when you're standing in it or click the ‚Äúi‚Äù icon next to the room name in your rooms list.
Hit "Edit" in the upper right corner. It's like the secret password to your room's control panel.
In the Basic Information tab, tap on the field labeled "Radio." It's not a time machine, but it'll sure feel like it when the music starts playing!
Search for Shoutcast radio stations and just tap on your chosen station. The music will start spinning automatically in your room, turning it into your private concert!

Feel like switching up the soundtrack later? Just dance back to this page to change the radio station. And if you're after some peace and quiet, head to "Radio" in Room Settings and tap "Clear Music" in the upper right corner.
Remember, the right tune can make your room, so choose your vibe and hit play!

article_title: How does the Highrise chat filter work?

structured_content.content: Our shiny new system is designed to keep the chat in Highrise as friendly and respectful as the neighborhood dog (minus the slobber). It keeps a keen eye out for nasties like harassment, explicit content, and hate speech, while still letting you chat about life, the universe, and why pineapple on pizza is controversial.

So what's allowed and what's not? If it's in our Community Guidelines' naughty list, it'll tickle our filter's radar. Casual swearing? Sure, we're 13+, after all. But targeted abuse, explicit stuff, or a vocabulary that would make a sailor blush? That'll be a no-go.

Here's the fun part: our filter is smarter than your average bear. It looks at words in context, not just individually. So, whether you're talking about soccer balls or... well, other balls, it knows the difference.

Each player gets a reputation based on their chat history. Think of it like a social credit score. If you're the model citizen of chat land, you'll enjoy more chat privileges. But if you're a serial disturber of the peace, some of those privileges might be put on pause.

Slip up and get a bad rep? No worries! You can get back in our good books by behaving nicely. Reputation is fluid - it doesn't change instantly, and you won't be branded a villain for one angry message. Just keep the chat clean and friendly for a bit, and you'll be back in the green.
We're still tweaking and tuning the system, so we appreciate your patience during this "getting it just right" phase. Got feedback, or questions, or just want to say hi? Drop us a line at

article_title: What are Highrise house-made Brands?

structured_content.content: Highrise-made brands are curated collections of items and accessories centered around a unifying aesthetic. These brands feature limited-time grabs, furniture collections, and shop collections purchasable with both Gold and Bubbles.

If you're in the market for a cohesive, updated look, search no more. We'll keep rolling out new brands as we continue to build out both the SkyRise Mall and the Highrise World at large, so you'll always be able to find a brand that suits your identity.
Soft pastels, gentle fabrics, and precious aesthetics.

Edgy doesn't begin to cover it. Elixir takes the dark aesthetics of classic goth and elevates it with simple, elegant modern staples. Elixir is the antidote to overprocessed, oversaturated, and cliche styles, and pares back on excessive fluff to reveal the foundations of the alternative fit: tasteful silhouettes, dark moods, and the eclipse of rules. üñ§

structured_content.content: We love seeing your ideas come to life in events, so why not share the love even more with Mini Design Contests? These competitions are a separate category from Grab Design Contests - check the FAQ for more information on those.
Items designed for Mini Design Contests are typically featured in Item Collections and other shop pages. Winners always receive the items they designed that made it into the game for free!

Here are some rules and guidelines to help clarify some of the most common questions we have about Grab Design Contests. Please note that this applies primarily to mini contests and some guidelines may differ for our grab contests.
All entries must be your original creation.

You may incorporate art assets from Highrise or other sources to help express your idea, however, you must significantly change or add to it in order to make it your own unique design. Entering images directly from other games, avatar creator apps, art sites, Instagram, etc. is not allowed.
Designs depicting copyrighted characters or other IPs will be disqualified.
Unless specifically stated as a collaboration, you may not enter artwork created by other members. Commissioned designs will be disqualified.

Mini Design Contests may call for entries to include anywhere from 1-10 unique items, depending on the contest. If a contest calls for a range of items, you can choose the number of items you‚Äôd like to submit, and you may also enter up to
All avatar items must be clearly visible in your entry. Items that are unclear or obscured may be modified or left out of the final lineup.
Final entries must be submitted through the User Design Contest feature, available through a bot in the Welcome Plaza

All designs must follow the Highrise code of conduct and community guidelines. Offensive or exclusionary content won‚Äôt be considered - we want to highlight entries that reflect the values of our community
All submissions will be regarded as User-Generated Content as defined in the

After the contest deadline has passed, Highrise staff will review all contest entries under the contest hashtag and select a number of finalists. Finalist selection is based on a combination of factors. This can include:
Visual appeal
Uniqueness of design
Interpretation of theme
Feasibility (Can Highrise actually make your items work in-game within our current technical constraints?)
Community interest
As of March 2021, judging takes into consideration an entry's popularity within the community, including number of likes and comments.
Winners who enter the following contest under an alternate account will be disqualified.
Collaborations that include a finalist from the previous contest are only eligible for a shoutout spot.
Winners are announced 1-2 days after the contest deadline.
will receive a gold prize and the items inspired by their design.
Sometimes we‚Äôll also highlight some designers as
If you are

Once winners have been announced, please email us by going to Profile > Settings > FAQ > Contact Us in top-right corner > Community Requests.  Open a new message and include HD images of your design and any close-ups or detail views, along with any additional notes or instructions for our staff artists.
For winning designs, include a full list of items. It helps us a lot when items are clearly labeled.
When your items release, you'll them along with your gold prize in form of gift boxes under the Gifts section of your Inbox. Enjoy!

It helps when everything in your design makes sense with the theme and fits together well. There are many ways to achieve this, such as using a particular color palette or specific design elements throughout the design, having a strong central concept/story/aesthetic/mood, etc. If something seems out of place, it might be better to change it or leave it out.
We‚Äôre always looking to spice up our inventories with items inspired by diverse sources, so push your creativity!

To keep the contest hashtag free of clutter and easy to navigate, please post your entry as a multi-image post. The first image of your post must show your full design. Include close-ups and detail views in the rest of your post instead of making separate posts. If something is covered up in your design, include a detail view of it by itself so we can see the whole item.

There are technical limitations that affect the way items layer and animate in our system. Designs that will not work well with our system will need to be modified or combined, which may affect your item count. Refer to the Current Avatar Item Layering Guide in the FAQ for more info.
We just want to see your most beautiful and polished final design on the contest hashtag page.
Be kind and thoughtful when giving or receiving feedback, and congratulate each others' successes.

Don't tag your sneak peeks, WIPs, close-ups, and other non-final entry posts with the contest hashtag. This clutters up the Browse page and makes it difficult for us to find your actual final entries. If you would like to show close-ups and detail shots, please include them as part of your main entry post.
Any additional artwork submitted afterward will not be considered.
This makes it harder to find your original post, as well as cluttering up the UDC Browse page.

People should be voting on your entry because they enjoy your design, not because they might win something from you. Members who host giveaways in exchange for votes will be disqualified from the contest.
Think of each contest as an opportunity to practice and improve your design skills. While resubmitted designs are allowed, these designs have a much lower chance of being selected.

article_title: Why are my items missing?

structured_content.content: Don't worry if you can't seem to find your favorite plushie! When you so thoroughly imbue virtual items with life of their own, it is to be expected that they will occasionally go rogue and simply up and disappear to who knows what god-forsaken place for their occult plushie rituals.
A simple restart will bring any missing item home again!

Double tap on the home button on your device. Swipe up on the preview for Highrise, and then reload the app. Any missing items should reappear in their respective clothing, furniture or gold bar inventory.
We can help track it down!
When you first acquired the item, and from whom
When you first noticed it missing
Was it ever in your Storefront?
Was it ever in trade?
With whom were you trading, and when?
What's its favorite bedtime snack?
Were you wearing it during an update?
And any other information which may be useful! If you notice it disappeared after you equipped a new grab item, for example, we may be able to trace whatever bug caused it to vanish.

article_title: Grab Design Contests: Rules and Guidelines

Winning player designs will be used as inspiration for an official Highrise grab, and runners-up get a small selection of their items turned into rewards. Winners always receive the items they designed for free!

That being said, here are a few rules and guidelines to help clarify some of the most common questions we have about Grab Design Contests. Please note that this applies primarily to full Grab Design Contests; rules differ for Mini Design Contests, so check the FAQ for more information.

You may incorporate art assets from Highrise or other sources to help express your idea, and we accept the use of tracing and other drawing aids. For runner-up designs, include a full list of items listed in order of preference. Typically only 4 items will be made from runner-up designs. Our staff will determine which items will be made, but we try to honor requests and preferences where possible.
Usually, we send designers 2 sets of their items. If you‚Äôre a collaborator, we'll send each partner 1 set, along with half the gold prize.
We'll usually send you some previews of your items before they go live, along with their expected launch date. Please note that we typically

Winning designs will be released as grabs that can be spun with gold. Items made from runners-up will be released as event rewards. You'll receive your items and gold prize in-game in the form of gift boxes under the Gifts section of your Inbox. Enjoy!

It helps when everything in your design makes sense with the theme and fits together well. There are many ways to achieve this, such as using a particular color palette or specific design elements throughout the design, having a strong central concept/story/aesthetic/mood, etc. If something seems out of place, it might be better to change it or leave it out.

Are they both equally interesting and well thought out, or has more effort been put into one over the other? A super elaborate feminine outfit doesn‚Äôt make up for a very basic masculine one. Push your creativity!

To keep the contest hashtag free of clutter and easy to navigate, please post your entry as a multi-image post. The first image of your post must show your full design with both outfits. Include close ups and detail views in the rest of your post instead of making separate posts. If something is covered up in your design, include a detail view of it by itself so we can see the whole item.
Are there any items in your design that are particularly unique, fun, beautiful, etc? Are there items that stand out as obvious Legendaries or Epics, or does everything feel like Rares?

There are technical limitations that affect the way items layer and animate in our system. Designs that will not work well with our system will need to be modified or combined, which may affect your item count. Refer to the Current Avatar Item Layering Guide in the FAQ for more info.

12 is the minimum required, but we often need to combine certain member-designed items because of technical constraints. This could cause your design to have fewer than 12 items in total, which unfortunately disqualifies the entry.
We just want to see your most beautiful and polished final design on the contest hashtag page.
Be kind and thoughtful when giving or receiving feedback, and congratulate each others' successes.

Don't tag your sneak peeks, WIPs, close ups, and other non-final entry posts with the contest hashtag. This clutters up the Browse page and makes it difficult for us to find your actual final entries. If you would like to show close ups and detail shots, please include them as part of your main entry post.
Any additional artwork submitted afterwards will not be considered.
This makes it harder to find your original post, as well as cluttering up the UDC Browse page.

People should be leaving likes and comments because they enjoy your design, not because they might win something from you. Members who host giveaways in exchange for likes and comments on their entries will be disqualified from the contest.
Items that are too similar to existing ones may be excluded from the final grab, but will not disqualify an entire design.
Think of each contest as an opportunity to practice and improve your design skills. While resubmitted designs are allowed, these designs have a much lower chance of being selected.

article_title: What is the Market?

structured_content.content: The Market is a marketplace system that allows you to buy and sell items instantly.
Go to Shop, and click Market on the top left-hand corner. Here is where you can begin to shop around or start listing your own inventory extras.
Once you've opened the Black Market menu, tap on the ‚ûï in the upper right to list your items.
Select the item you'd like to list and set a price. Each type of rarity will require a different minimum price:
On the "List an Item" screen, you'll see a few key bits of info: the current number of listings; the
You can check out your listings and toggle through the filters for
return to the My Listings tab and toggle the

When you open the Market, you'll see a page full of newly listed goods. Tap on an item that catches your fancy to open a menu presenting users who currently have that item for sale, and then peruse the listings to find the best deals!
Each item will display number of listings, floor price, and average price
Scroll through various users to see who's selling for the best price!
The item you list must be:
Tradeable
A clothing item
Not currently available in a secondhand grab or active trade
Don't panic! This is essentially the same behavior as when you place an item inside a trade or Secondhand Grab machine. The item will be returned to you if you cancel the listing.
It is currently not possible to edit an active listing. Instead, you can remove the listing to return the item to your inventory and then list it again at the correct price.
Note: If you list an item for an incorrect price and it sells before you can cancel and correct it, there is no way to reverse the trade. So please be cautious when listing your items.

This is done to reduce Gold inflation in the Highrise economy. We want your Gold and items to maintain value over time, and the simplest way to do this is to place a small fee on player-to-player transactions.

To efficiently manage the high volume of Market listings, we've introduced a 30-day expiration policy. After this period, expired listings will be removed from the Market and restored to your account.

article_title: What are scams and how do I make sure I'm not scammed?

structured_content.content: Be wary of scammers! They come in all shapes and sizes.

Don‚Äôt let anyone borrow your items; oftentimes, they won‚Äôt give it back, no matter how ardently they swear they will. We don‚Äôt have any way of verifying that an item was meant to be returned, or recovering borrowed items. All trades are final. If you do want to keep your item‚Ä¶ Hold on to it!

If someone is offering free gold or items, don‚Äôt fall for it! This is an easy and terribly common way for people to gain access to your account. Sometimes, you may be sent to web pages advertising free gold, which ask for your username, password, and email address. Invariably, this information will be used to enter your account and trade out all your hard-earned clothes and gold.

The only currency to be used in Highrise is gold: this means no cash. If you sell for IRL money, or advertise your kik or Paypal on your profile, your account is subject to an ban. Just keep your transactions limited to virtual currency and in-app channels to avoid a ban!

If you see someone advertising free gold or selling for cash, report them! Head to their profile page and tap the ellipses in the upper right to report. You can also inform a moderator and we'll look into it; we really appreciate your help in keeping the marketplace clean!

article_title: How do I trade?

structured_content.content: See someone selling an item you like, or want to swap with a friend? Trade away!
‚Äã
Trade items and gold with any player by first sending them a message! Once you are in chat, hit the trade option to the left of the text field, then choose "start a trade" to initiate a trade.
Tap on any of the nine blank squares to add an item from your inventory. You‚Äôll be able see the items your trading partner enters on their side of the trade window.

After entering your items/gold into the trade box, hit "Lock." Both you and your partner will have to lock and confirm the trade in order to finish the transaction and each receive your end of the bargain.

Be sure to keep an eye on the items in your trading partner‚Äôs box! Some wily players will remove their items at the last second before you both lock and confirm. However, if your trading partner unlocks the trade after you‚Äôve confirmed, the trade will be unlocked on your end as well, and you‚Äôll have to restart the lock>confirmation sequence.

Hit Collect to claim your new item! This closes the trade sequence; both parties will need to collect the trade before new items may be entered into trade again. Your new item will be automatically added to your inventory.

article_title: How do I change my username?

structured_content.content: Players can change their username by visiting their account's settings page and selecting the "Username" option under account management. Please see the image below if you are having trouble locating this option.
When a player changes their username, this changes their username everywhere on the application. The username that you use to log in is also changed to your newly set username.
All players receive one name change for free but all name changes after that will cost 10,000 gold.

After any name change, players receive a 14-day period where they can revert to their original username for free. During that 14-day window, their original username is reserved which will prevent other players from taking it. However, if these 14-days lapse then players will have to pay 10,000 coins if they wish to change their username back. Please note though that the username may be taken by other players once the 14 day period passes so it may no longer be available.

Players can only change their username to a username that is available. So if the username you are seeking is already taken by another user you will not be able to choose it. On top of this, the standard username rules apply.
Players cannot take over inactive usernames, sorry. If a player has a username set then that username cannot be used by anyone else even if that player has not been active for a while.

article_title: What is Safety Lock?

structured_content.content: Want to secure your account even further? No worries, we got you covered! Safety Lock is a feature that gives you an additional layer of security beyond your username and password.

Safety lock allows you to set a 6-digit PIN on your account that prevents anyone who logs into your account on a different device from accessing specific features until they input your 6-digit PIN correctly. The features that are blocked off until your PIN is entered are:
Trading
Changing your email address
Changing your password
Connecting accounts (such as Google, Snapchat, etc.)
Adding items to a Secondhand Grab machine
Changing your username

You can access the safety lock and set up your 6-digit PIN via your account‚Äôs settings page. Simply tap on the safety lock and enable it, and you‚Äôll then be prompted to select a 6-digit PIN. Please see the images below if you‚Äôre having trouble:
Nope! It‚Äôs an optional feature, but more security never hurts, right?
Yup! A registered email address is required. Please make sure you use a secure email that you have access to, as you‚Äôll be resetting your PIN via this email if you ever forget it.

Ah, forgetful, are we? That‚Äôs fine, we planned for this. In your settings, on the Safety Lock page, just simply choose the ‚Äòforgot pin‚Äô option. Once that option is selected we'll go ahead and send you a pin reset link to your registered email address.
Nope, your 6-digit PIN is encrypted. Our support team can‚Äôt see, hear, touch, or smell it. Bummer!
If you choose not to activate our Safety Lock feature and your account is compromised, we can assist you in recovering your account, but any items lost cannot be returned.

article_title: Staying safe on Highrise

structured_content.content: At Highrise, our number one goal is for players to connect from around the world and come together to have fun in a safe and welcoming environment. To ensure the safety of our players, we have a host of tools players can use (and some working in the background) to keep them safe from bad actors. This guide will go through those tools and offer some general tips so that you can keep yourself as safe as possible while playing.

. We‚Äôve chosen this recommended age because many of our players tend to be on the older side and may discuss topics or use language not suitable for young children. Please note that regardless of your age, sexual content is not allowed on Highrise.
If we have reasons to believe a player might be younger than 13 years of age, and they are not able to provide proof of their age, they will be removed from the app.

When chatting with other players, it‚Äôs impossible to know who they really are or their true intentions, so please do not share your personal information with anyone for any reason. Things you should never share are your home address, phone number, real name, links to your social media, etc.

Never share your account details with any other players for any reason. Even if they promise things like ‚Äòfree gold‚Äô in return, these are tactics players will use to get onto your account and steal your items.

If a player sends you a link to any off-app website or form asking you to input your Highrise details, please do not follow the link as it may be malicious. Instead, report & block that player. These links are a common tactic known as phishing, and that player is attempting to gain access to your account to steal your items, or worse, install malicious software on your device.
For reference, Highrise staff will NEVER ask for your password or safety lock pin.
Here are some tips on keeping your account information safe:

If, for any reason, you no longer want a player to be able to contact you or interact with you in any way, you can block them using our block feature. Blocking a player will prevent them from messaging you, visiting your feed, tagging you in posts, and visiting your room.  You can block a player by visiting their profile, clicking the ellipses (three dots) in the top right corner, and then clicking the ‚ÄòBlock player‚Äô option.

If any player is violating our guidelines, you can report them to us, and our team will review your report and take appropriate action against that player. You can report a player by visiting their profile, clicking the ellipses (three dots) in the top right corner, clicking the ‚Äòreport‚Äô option, and then choosing the report reason. To report a player in a room without visiting their profile, you can click their avatar icon in the chatbox, then the flag in the top right corner of their mini profile view.

The general rule is once something has been uploaded to the internet, it is there forever. Please keep this in mind when deciding what to upload to your feed. Players can repost your photos and videos, take screenshots, download them, etc. So make sure you‚Äôre okay with this before hitting the post button.

article_title: User Design Contest Feature (UDC)

structured_content.content: User Design Contest (UDC) is a feature that allows players to submit their own item designs for various art competitions here at Highrise. Winning designs will be turned into real items by the art team.
All the contests! Here‚Äôs a quick refresher on the different types of art and design contests we run.
Grab Design Contests: players make a full grab of 12-15 unique items. Graabs are released in major events, and winners will receive the full grab (with their name credited!) alongside a gold prize.
Mini Design Contests: players design items or accessories for a grab or shop collection, and also receive name credit, gold, and the items themselves.
Art Design Contests: make a card, item, or decoration and have your work added directly to the game!

Remember! All contests have a cooldown period which will preclude a winner‚Äôs eligibility for that contest type for one contest cycle. For example, if you win a Grab Contest, you won‚Äôt be able to enter the next Grab Contest, but you can still enter a Mini Design or Art Design Contest.

The UDC system is accessible on web (joinhighrise.com) while a contest is running. Each time a contest starts, Highrise EN will make an announcement post with the contest dates and a link to the submission tool.
Inside the web menu, you‚Äôll see a set of contest stages running from:

This is the only period at which you can - you know - submit your entry. The Browse tab will be empty at this stage, so you won‚Äôt be able to view other user‚Äôs entries or cast any votes. Tab over to My Submissions to see your entries, and long press on a submission to pull up the Action Menu.

During this phase, you can start browsing through all contest entries; these are anonymous and randomized for each person. You‚Äôll be given a limited number of votes that you can use to boost your favorite designs. Votes cannot be withdrawn once cast, so choose carefully!
Highrise Staff will review and assemble the top-voted entries into a list of finalists. Hang tight - we‚Äôll notify you when this stage is over!

article_title: What should I do if my items are buggy?

structured_content.content: Sometimes you may encounter a buggy item - maybe a strand of hair won't change color, or your avatar's clothing clips or layers incorrectly. If you notice an item is buggy or glitched,
You will be connected with our Concierge Desk: please tell the concierge you want to report a buggy item. Our concierge team will ask you a few more questions to help filter your requests.
Once you are ready to make your report, please be as descriptive as possible about the issue you are experiencing.
This really helps us to understand the issue.
We will have the team assess the issue and determine if it's something we can fix. Please read the info below about
When we get a request to edit an item, we try to determine whether it is an objective bug vs subjective feedback.
An
Examples include:
Color changing parts not working (skin, hair, eye color)
Part of the item or avatar is missing
is a request based on the user's personal preference. The item isn't technically broken or buggy. The item is functioning as intended, but some users might prefer it to be different.
Examples include:
This item should be blue, not red
The position of this item is a little weird

When fixing bugs or editing items, we are always trying to improve the quality of our game. We definitely want to fix objective bugs, but subjective feedback is trickier. Sometimes editing an item that has already been released can have unintended effects: it could change the value of the item, affecting the in-game economy. Or, it could confuse and upset players who liked the item the way it was originally. We often have to assess each request on a case by case basis.

If you have a suggestion for an item edit, we encourage you to post it in our Canny under Art and Item Suggestions. We use the Canny to collect feedback from players, to learn how to improve the items we make in the future. In Canny, players can upvote suggestions they like, so it's easy to see what's popular amongst the community. If a post is getting a lot of attention in Canny, we will be sure to keep that suggestion in mind.
When we get a report of an item bug or a request to change an item, there are a lot of factors to consider when determining how to proceed.
Is it objectively buggy, flawed, broken or improperly set up? Does it lower the quality of our game?
Can we fix/change this? Sometimes there are objective bugs we don't have the ability to fix with our current system.
Will changing it affect the value of the item(s)?
Are there other users who would prefer the item not be changed?

Is this a user designed item? Is the user who designed this item requesting the change? Did that user have proper opportunity to review the item during the production process or are the requesting a change outside of the allotted feedback opportunity?

Each request will have different considerations, and sometimes we try different things. Overall, we are working to create a standardized policy that makes the community happy and helps create a quality game.

Unfortunately, there are some bugs or glitches with our items that we can't fix with our current system. In these cases, even though we all agree the item is buggy or flawed, we simply have to let it go.
Here's some examples of common bugs/glitches that we know about but can't fix:
Gloves are layering on top of the shirt sleeves
Pupils are animating outside the bounds of the eye
You can still report these issues and we will collect your reports to better understand and prioritize how our system can be improved.

article_title: What Are"Inspired By" Item Attributions?

structured_content.content: Highrise is a talented and creative community. We love to collaborate with players to design items for our world, and we‚Äôll always attribute player-inspired items to their designer. There are two ways that we find and feature players‚Äô creations.

We frequently host official design competitions; you can learn more in the FAQ under ‚ÄúHighrise Competitions and Rules.‚Äù When a player wins a design competition and we make their items in the game, we‚Äôll make an attribution note on the bottom of the item preview. This note will say ‚ÄúInspired by‚Äù with a link to the designer‚Äôs username. If an item you designed is missing attribution, reach out to our Concierge team to update it. Please include the contest and event the item is from and whether it was released in a grab, shop collection, or event rewards.

Sometimes we discover an outstanding player-designed item outside of a competition. It might be a random drawing, or a competition entry didn‚Äôt make it into a grab. If we decide to add one of these items to the game, we‚Äôll reach out to notify the player directly, and they‚Äôll receive compensation when the item is released. These items will also get a note of attribution at the bottom of the item preview.

An item will only have an attribution note if it was designed or inspired by a player; all other items are designed by artists on our staff. It‚Äôs not unusual for our art team and our players to find inspiration in similar trends and create similar designs independently by complete coincidence- this phenomenon is sometimes called parallel thinking. Most of the time, our staff isn‚Äôt aware of players‚Äô designs when developing items, and draw inspiration from and reference sources outside of the app such as fashion retailers, photos and illustrations on Pinterest and Instagram, Google image search, and even real life. In this case, a player who designs a similar item isn‚Äôt entitled to any type of compensation or attribution.

If you find an item in the game appears to be directly inspired by a player but doesn‚Äôt have proper attribution, please contact our Concierge team! Our Concierge team and staff artists will review these reports and determine if attribution is due or if it‚Äôs an instance of parallel thinking. Our staff respects the creative community of Highrise, and will always give credit where it is due.

article_title: I receive an error when trying to verify my Highrise account on Discord

structured_content.content: Depending on the circumstances, you might experience an error while trying to verify your account.
The errors begin with a number. We will cover all errors in this article and the best way to solve them:
Error 113

First, check to make sure you‚Äôre not already verified by checking if you have the ‚ÄúHighrise Verified‚Äù role assigned. If you can see the #verification channel in the channels list, then you are not verified yet.

Check to see if the Discord username (including the hashtag) in the pop-up matches the current one you‚Äôre logged into and are currently using in our official Discord server. If the username differs, click ‚ÄúNot you?‚Äù and log back in using the correct credentials. Then, attempt to complete the verification process again.
Alternatively, if you do not receive this pop-up, try going to

From here, check to see if your Highrise account is linked to a Discord account. If there is a Discord account linked, press ‚ÄúUnlink‚Äù and attempt to complete the verification process within the server again.

If you are unable to find a link to your main Highrise account, try logging out of the website (press on your character‚Äôs image at the top right, and then Log Out) and attempt to log back in with the credentials of your alternative account(s).
Navigate to
If you still receive Error 113 and are unable to find a Discord account linked to any of your Highrise accounts, please open a ticket within the Discord Server under
Error 114

Error 114 ‚Äì The Verification System detects that the Discord account you‚Äôre attempting to link is already connected to a Highrise account. This can occur when a user has more than one Discord account, Highrise account, or has recently granted another user access to their account.
When attempting to complete the verification process, check to see if you receive a pop-up that asks you to verify. The pop-up should look similar to this:

Check to see if the Discord username (including the hashtag) in the pop-up matches the current one you‚Äôre logged into and currently using in our official Discord server. If the username differs, click ‚ÄúNot you?‚Äù and log back in using the correct credentials. Then, attempt to complete the verification process again.
Alternatively, if you do not receive this pop-up, try going to
From here, check to see if your Highrise account is linked to a Discord account. If so, press ‚ÄúUnlink‚Äù and attempt to complete the verification process within the server again.

If you are unable to find a link to your main Highrise account, try logging out of the website (press on your character‚Äôs image at the top right, and then Log Out) and attempt to log back in with the credentials of your alternative account(s).
Go to
If you still receive Error 114 and are unable to find a Discord account linked to any of your Highrise accounts, please open a ticket within the Discord Server under
Error 116
Error 116 ‚Äì The Verification System detects that the Highrise account you‚Äôre attempting to link was created less than 24 hours ago.
Wait 24 hours then try to complete the verification process again.
Error 118

Error 118 ‚Äì  The Verification System detects that the Discord account you‚Äôre attempting to verify with is not the same one that you have inside our Discord server. This can occur when a user owns more than one Discord account and is logged in the wrong one.
When attempting to complete the verification process, check to see if you receive a pop-up that asks you to verify. The pop-up should look similar to this:

Ensure the Discord username (including the hashtag) in the pop-up matches the current one you‚Äôre logged into. If the username differs, click ‚ÄúNot you?‚Äù and log back in using the correct credentials. Then, attempt to complete the verification process again.
If you still receive Error 118 and are unable to find a Discord account linked to any of your Highrise accounts, try logging into Discord through the web browser
If you still are unable to verify, please open a ticket within the Discord Server under
Error 119
Error 119 ‚Äì The Verification System detects that you‚Äôre attempting to verify a Highrise account that has been suspended or banned.
You can contact Highrise Support to appeal the ban or suspension through
Error 120
Error 120 ‚Äì The Verification System detects that the Highrise account you‚Äôre attempting to verify has not been active recently.
Ensure you have the Highrise mobile app downloaded and log into it with your normal Highrise credentials. Interact on the app for 5-10 minutes and attempt to complete the verification process again.
If you still are unable to verify, please open a ticket within the Discord Server under
Error 401
Error 401 ‚Äì The Verification System detects that the authorization process was cancelled.

To ensure you can verify, please first authorize permission to access your Discord account. Ensure your Discord username and hashtag ID match identically to the one it asks you to authorize permissions for.
If you receive a pop-up that asks you to verify; the pop-up should look similar to this:

Ensure the Discord username (including the hashtag) in the pop-up matches the current one you‚Äôre logged into. If the username differs, click ‚ÄúNot you?‚Äù and log back in using the correct credentials. Then, attempt to complete the verification process again.
If you still are unable to verify, please open a ticket within the Discord Server under
Connection Error

This error is often a result of browser and network setting issues. Extensions, Ad-blockers, and Anti-virus use as well as VPNs, Proxies, public Wi-Fi, or Mobile data connections can interfere with the verification process.

Complete the verification process again in another web browser that hasn‚Äôt been used previously. This will ensure that no extension interferes with the Verification website. Turn off any VPNs and Proxies as well as Public Wi-Fi or mobile data. Once connected to a private Wi-Fi connection, try to complete the verification process again.

Avoid connecting your wallet to any website that is sent to you via private message! Only use the Official links provided through the Official Highrise Discord Server or through the Highrise Creature Club and Land Helpshift guides in-app.

Be aware that sharing your private key or seed phrase is similar to sharing the password of your an account. By sharing your private key or seed phrase, you are granting full access to your wallet to allow for any funds of assets to be transferred out of your wallet and into a scammer's wallet.

article_title: How do I purchase a Highrise Creature?

structured_content.content: ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: Purchasing Highrise Creatures is done at your own risk. Blockchain technology is still new and evolving, and there is a risk of scams and other malicious activities. Please stay informed about basic security measures, such as using strong passwords and two-factor authentication, and only use services from trusted sources.
To purchase a Highrise Creature Club NFT, you will need a Metamask wallet, crypto currency, and to be informed about the basic security measures of the blockchain technology.

A MetaMask wallet is like a digital bank account for your crypto currency. It allows you to store and manage your ETH (Ether) and other digital tokens in a secure, easy-to-use way. You can use your MetaMask wallet to purchase Highrise Creature Club NFTs and access all the perks and benefits that come with being a part of the club.
You should use a computer to use and create a MetaMask Wallete. It's the easiest and most safe way, and you should follow these steps:
Install the MetaMask browser extension from the official website (
Click the MetaMask icon in your browser to open the extension.
Click the "Create a Wallet" button on the welcome screen.
Enter a strong password to protect your wallet and click "Create". Make sure to write down your password and store it in a safe place.
Read and accept the terms of use and privacy policy, then click "All Done".

You will be shown your MetaMask seed phrase, which is a series of 12-24 words that can be used to restore your wallet if you forget your password or lose access to your account. Write down your seed phrase and store it in a safe place.

‚ö†Ô∏è This seed phrase can give anyone permanent full access to your account. Losing it means losing access to your account. Anyone with access to it can also have access to all the assets stored in your wallet. No one will ever ask you to share this information unless they‚Äôre trying to scam you.
Click the "Next" button to continue.
You will be taken to your MetaMask wallet, where you can view your accounts, transaction history, and other information.
Immutable X is the marketplace where the Highrise Creatures can be purchased. Once you have created a Metamask wallet and added funds, you need to connect your wallet to Immutable X.
Here‚Äôs how to connect your wallet to Immutable X:
Visit
Choose the Metamask option.
A Metamask popup will show up, press ‚ÄúNext‚Äù, and then ‚ÄúConnect‚Äù. Then go back to the Immutable X website, and press ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù.
A new Metamask popup will show up, press ‚ÄúNext‚Äù and ‚ÄúConnect‚Äù once again. And then press ‚ÄúSign‚Äù.
Your Metamask wallet should now be connected to Immutable X.
To purchase Highrise Creatures on Immutable X, you first need to purchase ETH (the crypto currency used to purchase Highrise Creatures.)
After your wallet has been connected to the Immutable website, (

The easiest way to add funds is using the first option: Credit Card. Simply choose how much ETH you want to buy, and follow the on-screen steps to checkout. After purchasing your funds will be added to Immutable X instantly.
Alternatively, you can purchase ETH directly through MetaMask in some countries, or by using exchange apps such as
If you have purchased ETH using one of these alternatives, you need to transfer it to Immutable X to be able to use it:
Visit the Immutable X website (
Choose ‚ÄúDeposit from Wallet‚Äù.
Select the ‚ÄúEthereum (ETH)‚Äù currency from the list.
Choose the amount of ETH that you want to transfer from your Metamask Wallet to your Immutable X wallet.
Press Confirm.
A Metamask popup will show up on your screen to confirm and sign the transaction.
Note: Transferring ETH requires a small gas fee to process the transaction. To learn more about gas and gas fees, check out:
Choose the Creature that you would like to purchase from the TokenTrove marketplace (
Press ‚ÄúBuy now‚Äù to instantly buy the Creature, or ‚ÄúMake an offer‚Äù, if you would like to make a different price offer to the owner of the Creature. Then follow the on-screen steps.
‚ö†Ô∏è
Creatures are only visible within your Immutable X/TokenTrove inventory as they require a layer-two blockchain for compatibility. They are
In order to be able to see your Creatures on Highrise and receive all the perks and benefits, you need to connect your Metamask wallet to your Highrise account.
Head to
Click over on your profile picture in the top right of the navigation bar. Then click on Settings. You‚Äôll see a section called Blockchain, press the Connect Metamask Wallet button.
A Metamask popup will show up, press Sign. After that your Wallet will have been connected successfully.
üéâ Now that you've integrated your crypto wallet, you'll be able to use your

You will automatically start receiving all the benefits and perks of owning a Highrise Creature for as long as your Metamask wallet containing at least one Highrise Creature remains connected to your Highrise account.

article_title: What is Highrise Concepts?

structured_content.content: Concepts is an evolved version of our current UDC (User Design Contest) tool. The Concepts hub currently lives on our website highrise.game - here, community members can view and submit item ideas for designated themes.
üëâWhere Concepts departs from the UDC model is that it allows A or B voting, a different vote scoring system, and even simultaneous submission and voting.

When someone wants to view and vote on the submitted artwork for a Concept, they‚Äôll be presented with two entries at once, and will choose their favorite between the two. Yes, this is just like our Style Challenge voting!
Also like our Style Challenges, scoring will be determined through
ùôèùôùùôö ùôíùôÉùôî:

In keeping with our vision of a Highrise entirely built by the community, we want to move toward a future where content moves in a transparent pipeline from sketch, to vector, to real item, with your innovation, intuition, and insight as key influences every step of the way.

Concepts lets you take a far more active role in choosing what kind of content gets released. By participating in the scoring process and bubbling up the best designs, you can let us know early on if a concept is in high demand and should be put into production.

Additionally, our Art Team will be using HR Concepts to submit their own art sketches to the voting pool, so we can all collaborate as a community on what kinds of looks we like the best. We‚Äôre imagining a future where everyone can get involved in choosing what gets released!

structured_content.content: Tired of the common folk invading your space? Want to roll out the virtual red carpet for your VIP friends only? Or maybe you just need some 'me' time. Whatever it is, you've got the keys to your castle!

Mosey on over to the rooms directory, and choose "My rooms". Look for the '!' icon next to the room you want to tweak. Tap it, then hit 'Room Settings'. Sounds like a secret spy code, right?
Now, you'll see the 'Access' option. Give it a tap, and voila! You can choose who gets to party in your room, and who gets the virtual "Do Not Disturb" sign.
So, whether it's friends-only Fridays or solitaire Sundays, you're the boss. Remember, a good host knows when to open the door...and when to lock it!

article_title: How Do I Collaborate With Others When Designing My Room?

structured_content.content: Looking to set up those wobbly bookcases? Remember the buddy system ‚Äì it's not just for field trips! Bring a friend (or two) along for the ride, and they can even bring their own furniture too ‚Äì once you've given them Design Rights.
Here's how to turn room decorating into a party:

article_title: How do I submit a Concept?

structured_content.content: Navigate to the Concept theme of your choice, and tap the Upload Submission button to begin.
You‚Äôll be prompted to Upload Photos from your library, camera, or files.
You can upload up to 5 images per Submission. The number of total Submissions will vary per contest, but will typically land around 10 or so.

Consider each Submission a separate entity. For example, if the Concept you‚Äôre entering asks for a face item, and you have created designs for eyes, lips, and a nose, use one submission for each item. This is to help keep the Concepts process more fair, clear, and easier for everyone to actually pick the items they want!

Once you‚Äôve chosen the photos for your Submission, you can either add more, or delete from your current selection. If you‚Äôd like to reorder your images, you‚Äôll have to delete and reupload your photos in the proper order.
When you‚Äôve finalized the images you‚Äôd like to use for your Submission, you‚Äôll be given a preview. Tap Create.
You can view your submissions any time from within the Concept card page. Add another entry by tapping the + sign.
Change your mind about a submission? Navigate to
First, be sure to check your internet connection. We know, this is a boring tip - but it‚Äôs often the issue!
Next, try to exit out of the Concepts page and re-enter the My Submissions portal to confirm your entry isn‚Äôt there.
Finally, be sure to check that all your image size does not exceed 5MB.
Um no.

Help us ensure that voting is accurate! Please keep each submission limited to one concept apiece. For grabs, this means using one Submission per grab concept; in the case of single-item Concepts, each item should be its own submission.

You can still use a clothed avatar as a model for your design, and share multiple examples of how it might look with different outfit combinations. However, your first slide should always clearly label or highlight your actual design.
A: You won‚Äôt be able to update the images in a submission after you create it. If you need to change the artwork or order of your slides, you‚Äôll have to create a new Submission.
Accidentally delete a concept after the submisison period is over? No worries! Reach out to our Support team. We can restore your deleted submission!

article_title: Communicating with the Highrise Art Team

structured_content.content: If your Concept is selected, we‚Äôll open a direct line of contact with our Art Team to help you transform your design into a real item! The Concepts tool features an integrated messenger, so you won‚Äôt have to leave the app‚Äôs webpage to keep the conversation going!
When the Concept ends, you‚Äôll receive a message from our team, and your winning submission will get a groovy new

Tap into your Selected Submission to open the messenger view. Throughout this process, you‚Äôll receive messages from our Art Team directly in your Highrise Inbox. Once you‚Äôre in the Concepts web view, you‚Äôll see a small notification bubble next to any Selected Submission with pending messages.
Send our team your design notes, special requests, and additional concept and reference artwork in the Concepts Messenger. Tap the paperclip to attach additional images.
Our team will share updates on how your concept is progressing and ask questions as they come up. When your concept is ready for preview, we‚Äôll share a sneak peek for your review.

As a quick heads up, our production turnaround is pretty speedy. When we send previews, please share any edit requests with us as soon as possible; ideally, within 48 hours. Also, keep in mind that even if you send edit requests right away, we can‚Äôt guarantee that all changes will be implemented, due to an array of possible blockers (like technical layering issues, stylistic choices, time constraints, or significant departures from your original winning concept).

The Concepts messenger will close for your winning Submission about a week after your items go live. If you have any other feedback or concerns about your items after this period, please reach out to our Support Team for assistance.
After all edits are complete and your items are ready, we‚Äôll send them to you as an Inbox Gift about 48 hours before they‚Äôre due to go live.

article_title: Tips, Tricks, and Other Questions

structured_content.content: Concepts empowers not only our artists, but our entire community, to shape the direction of all Highrise art. An updated scoring system gives everyone a better chance to influence a Concept‚Äôs winning designs, and by sharing our staff‚Äôs designs before they‚Äôre released, we can dissolve the boundaries between ‚Äúofficial‚Äù and community designs. Concepts lets everyone share in the experience of creating and watching as your favorite items travel from idea to your closet.

Yes! For now, we‚Äôre retaining much of the structure of our current Design Contest prize distribution. Unless otherwise stated, all winning Concept artists will receive 5 copies of each item they make and 5k gold per item.
Sometimes, we‚Äôll run special Concepts with cash payouts (as in the case of Sale items). Our team will let you know what information we‚Äôll need to send your compensation.
Every artist needs an audience who supports their creative endeavors! However,
Every submission is randomly paired, which means that every single entry stands a fair chance of acheiving a high rating using the Elo scoring system.
Technically, yes.

The Elo rating system is designed to predict the outcome of a matchup. If an entry is performing well, it will fall in the ranks quickly if a new contender consistently defeats it in a matchup. This allows for a newer submission to quickly gain a higher score than older submissions, if it's performing well.
While Concepts does allow the possibility of a simultaneous Submission and Voting phase, for our first Concept (Artist's Lounge), we'll be keeping the two phases separate.
Every Concept will have a brief description of the theme and item type you should create, but these are only starting points: your vision is at the heart of this feature, and of Highrise as a whole.
Medium: Feel free to create your Concept using pen and paper, Photoshop, Illustrator, Procreate, or any other medium you‚Äôre most comfortable with.
Re-entries: If one of your Concepts or Contest designs doesn‚Äôt get selected, you may resubmit your Concept art to any number of relevant Concepts. However, please stay on theme!
Originality: Your work should be your own. Any artwork lifted from Instagram, DeviantArt, or other art communities will be disqualified, as will designs depicting copyrighted characters or other IPs.
Drawing Assistance: You may use references, drawing aids, and staff-made Highrise items as bases in your Concepts. We‚Äôre looking for good
Redesigns: You may submit a redesign of any existing staff-made Highrise item in your Concept, regardless of the Concept‚Äôs theme.

Player Items: Anyone may freely use Highrise items designed by staff as references and in redesigned items. However, you may not trace items designed by other players. Please report any designs you believe to be using player material, and our team will review the submission.
All submissions will be regarded as User-Generated Content as defined in the

Got lots of ideas? Great! Share multiple concepts in multiple submissions. This is to help ensure that when someone views your concept, they are able to clearly identify the item they‚Äôre voting for. We‚Äôve increased the maximum number of total submissions you can create to account for the new Elo scoring system. Help us keep Concepts fair!

It‚Äôs dangerous to go alone! Take a partner - if you like. Collaborations are allowed in Concepts, but for now, collaborations are limited to dynamic duos only. If you have a partner, please have only one person submit your shared Concept, and add your partner‚Äôs name on the entry.
Our messenger only supports 1-1 conversations, so please keep in mind that whoever submits your Concept will be responsible for all communication with our team.

Additionally, we do not increase total compensation (items, gold) for collaborations. When dividing your prize items, we‚Äôll split your total as evenly as we can, and send any spillover items to the artist who submitted the Concept. For example, if everyone gets 5x copies of their item, the submitter will receive 3, and their partner will receive 2. Feel free to redistribute the items and gold afterward!

Attempts to artificially boost your score by offering gold or other incentives in exchange for gold is not allowed. Additionally, any other malicious behaviors outlined in our Community Guidelines (ie, witch-hunting, newsfeed campaigns against another artist, etc) may also result in your disqualification from a Concept, and possibly lead to a mute, suspension, or a ban.
Looking for more info on how to create Highrise items? Check out our Avatar Item Layering Guide in the FAQ for more info!

Teamwork makes the dream work! When communicating with Highrise Staff through the Concepts messenger, please be respectful and remember that we‚Äôre all in this together, and all want to see Highrise continue to evolve into its best self.

Worried about whether your Concept suits a theme? Don‚Äôt be! No one will ever get disqualified for trying something new, or slightly misinterpreting a Concept‚Äôs prompt. In any case, the people will decide whether your design matches a theme or not, and bubble up the best, most creative entries.

article_title: How do I vote on Concepts?

structured_content.content: When you vote, you‚Äôll be presented with two random designs. If a design has more than one image, view additional slides by swiping right-to-left.
Pick your favorite! Tap on an entry to select it, and tap again to confirm your choice.
After you confirm, you‚Äôll be presented with a new pair of concepts. Votes are infinite, so keep reviewing concepts as long as you‚Äôd like - or until supper calls ü•™

This tool uses ELO rating! This style of scoring gives each entry a score that increases and decreases depending on its total wins over a series of matchups; importantly, in this system each vote carries a different weight depending on the ranks of the two competitors.

For example, an entry will receive a modest impact to its score when paired against an entry with an equal rating. But if a highly voted entry is paired against a low voted entry, it will receive a bigger hit to its score - and the lower voted entry will receive a bigger bonus.

This system is also what allows us to run voting alongside an open submission period, as votes are not tallied via total quantity, but rather by total score. A new, recently submitted design will always have a chance to rise through the ranks if it receives enough attention! Unless you submit like, an hour before the contest ends. In that case, good luck kid.
Read more about the system
All pairs are random. None of the following will affect pairing or order of appearance:
Time of entry
Current score
Whether you‚Äôve seen an entry before
Whether you approved or disapproved an entry
Who submitted the design

Right now, we do not have a system in place for retaining an index of your votes. Additionally, there is no navigation for going back to rescind a vote, or bookmarks to revisit an entry later. Go with the flow, and let your feelings guide you!

Nope! The idea behind Concepts is to give every single design an equal chance of being seen. The A or B voting mechanic should bubble up the best designs over time; which means that every vote you cast matters. When voting, you're not picking the
By voting on each entry, you help to give us an accurate read on how well the community is resonating with a particular design.

Report an entry for violating our Community Guidelines by tapping the red flag in the upper left corner. Please share a comment on why you are submitting your report in the text box, and then hit Submit to send your report to our dedicated Trust & Safety team.

structured_content.content: Got your eye on some virtual IKEA-like swank? Got your creative juices flowing like a rushing waterfall? Well, let's turn your pixel pad into the plush palace of your dreams! If you're wondering where to snag that ritzy furniture, check this out.
Flex your interior designer muscle by tapping the artsy pencil icon in the corner of your screen. Remember, you gotta be in a room where you're the boss of design!
A fancy menu will pop up at the screen's bottom, revealing your glorious collection of furniture. Filter your furniture and floors/walls by giving those icons next to 'all' a friendly poke.
Can't find that exquisite Chesterfield sofa you own? Don't sweat, just type its name in the search bar. If you own it, we'll sniff it out!
Now comes the fun part - play virtual dollhouse by dragging and dropping your furniture just where you want it!
Want to rearrange? Just grab that chic chair or fabulous painting and drag it around like it's dance night!
Change the axes of movement in the Item Menu to move your items vertically or horizontally - the perfect trick for constructing those lofty towers!
Some items come with bonus features in the Item Menu:
"Set Teleport Destination" changes where players land via teleport or contact with moving items.
"Set Speed" is for the speedsters out there - the higher the number, the faster your items!
"Change State" is for the multi-taskers. Tap it to change the height of blocks, the state of the curtains, and more!

Once your room is looking more Pinterest than pixel, tap on the 'Save' icon in the upper right corner. If you suddenly get designer's remorse, hit 'exit' in the left corner to cancel all changes, or 'Undo' to reverse your last tweak.
Time to let your creativity run wild, we can't wait to see what magic you weave!

structured_content.content: Your creations are dazzling, and we might just have used them in a Highrise advertisement. If so, you could be eligible for a shiny GOLD reward! Let's break it down:
If your character's image, feed content, or a room you designed starred in an ad for less than 3 seconds, you're set for a 990 GOLD reward. It's like a "blink and you'll miss it" bonus!
If your creation held the spotlight for over 3 seconds, you're in for a whopping 3000 GOLD! Talk about a superstar salary!
But, if you were just casually hanging out in public rooms when we caught you on camera, there's no GOLD reward for that cameo.

article_title: What Is Earned Gold?

structured_content.content: Earned Gold is a flexible currency awarded to community creators. Item designers, room and World builders, bot creators, and hosts typically receive Earned Gold as compensation for enriching Highrise with their art, worlds and experiences.
Earned Gold can be used just like regular Gold: with it, you can spin grabs, trade, tip, and use it to buy items, Voice Tokens, Room Boost, and more.
However,
Right now, you
When you visit the Creator Exchange, you may view your total Earned Gold below the description for Cashout requirements. This number
Please note that, again, your total Earned Gold balance is

Whenever you use gold, payments will preferentially draw from your regular Highrise Gold before tapping into your Earned Gold. If you think of your gold wallet as a big bucket, imagine Earned Gold living at the bottom of the bucket: any purchase you make will scrape away gold from the top of the bucket before reaching your Earned Gold.
However, should you run out of regular gold, you will begin to draw on your Earned Gold funds!
Please keep an eye on your Earned Gold in the Creator Exchange if you would prefer to save it up for a Cashout.
Earned Gold spent in Highrise will always function like regular gold. Anyone you Tip using Earned Gold will receive regular Gold.
Visit the
Here are the overall requirements to Cashout your Earned Gold.
Before you can submit a Cashout Request for your Earned Gold, you‚Äôll need to meet the following criteria:

Only one cash out request per calendar month: when planning your withdrawals, please bear in mind that processing your request may take up to 30 days. As such, we only support one cashout per user per month.
Be at least 13 years of age.
Have at least 35,000 Earned Gold in your account: the Earned Gold you currently own is displayed on the Cashout screen.
You may cash out less than 35,000 EG. However, you must exceed this minimum threshold before you can submit a withdrawal request.

Be in compliance with service requirements: use only your real information when creating an account through Tipalti. Fraudulent activity will result in a ban, with no additional recourse for withdrawing your pending funds.

Be in complete compliance with Highrise TOS and Community Guidelines: suspended and banned accounts are not eligible to cash out. Additionally, HR may deny a cash out request at the discretion of our Trust & Safety team.
Have a W-9 (for US taxpayers) or W-8 (for non-US taxpayers): when onboarding with Tipalti, you‚Äôll need to have your identification ready.
Have a payable Tipalti account on file: tap the link to onboard with Tipalti. We‚Äôll go over the onboarding steps in more detail below.

. Here are the payment options:

For most US taxpayer individuals, you may use your Social Security Number (SSN) as your TIN (Tax ID Number).
For businesses, you may enter your EIN (Employer ID Number).
For non-US individual and business entities, you may complete and upload the W-8 8233 form provided by Tipalti.

Cashouts require a minimum of 35,000 EG, but you may withdraw any amount below this threshold (ie, you own 40,000 and can cash out 30,000)
The current exchange rate is 750 Earned Gold = $1 USD.
You may only request a Cashout once per calendar month
After you submit your request, HR Staff will review your submission to ensure you meet our requirements (accurate payment information, good community standing, etc.)
Check the status of your Cashout request and review previous Cashouts by visiting Payment History on the Creator Exchange.

Earned Gold will labeled as such in your Gifts tab whenever you win a Concept, host an experience, achieve high Worlds engagement, or win a Highrise-sponsored competition.

No; once you‚Äôve submitted a Cashout request, there is no way to undo or edit your request. If you‚Äôve made an error, please contact our Support team so we can clear your request and refund your Earned Gold.

No; you‚Äôll have to onboard again. Old accounts are not transferrable, so please onboard with Tipalti again to get set up for Cashout.

No: you need a payable account with Tipalti to receive your funds. If you are unable to finish the onboarding process for any reason (no payment method, no tax ID) you may still use Earned Gold just like regular Gold in Highrise.

Don't want to hand your tip directly to another player? No worries, drop it in their tip jar to show some appreciation.
So go ahead, spread some gold love around! Tipping: it's just our way of making Highrise a little richer.

article_title: Why was I double-charged? How do I deal with an accidental purchase?

structured_content.content: Oh no! Double Charged or Bought Something by Mistake? Here's What to Do.
We know mistakes can happen, and nothing ruins a great game session like a billing issue. If you've been double charged or accidentally made a purchase, follow these steps to resolve it quickly:

For iOS: Open the Settings app, tap on your name, then 'iTunes & App Store'. Tap your Apple ID, then 'View Apple ID'. You might need to sign in. Tap 'Purchase History' to check for any duplicate charges.
For Android: Open the Google Play Store app. Tap the three horizontal lines (menu) in the top left corner. Tap 'Account' then 'Purchase History' to check for any duplicate charges.
For iOS: Go to reportaproblem.apple.com, log in with your Apple ID, find the purchase in question, and select 'Report a Problem'. Choose the appropriate option and submit your request.

For Android: Open the Google Play Store app, go to 'Account', then 'Purchase History'. Find the purchase, tap on it, and select 'Request a Refund' or 'Report a Problem'. Fill out the form and submit it.
If you're unable to get a refund through Apple or Google, reach out to us directly. Open the app, tap the gear icon for settings, select 'Help Center', then 'Contact Us'.
Provide all necessary details: your player ID, a screenshot of the purchase receipt, and a description of the issue. Our support team will investigate and assist you.
Double-check your purchases before confirming them.

Enable purchase authentication to avoid accidental buys. For iOS, go to Settings > Screen Time > Content & Privacy Restrictions > iTunes & App Store Purchases > Require Password. For Android, go to Google Play Store > Settings > Require authentication for purchases.
Mistakes happen, but we‚Äôre here to help ensure your Highrise experience remains smooth and enjoyable. Thanks for your patience, and happy gaming!
